title: Zakat
summary: Zakat (Arabic: زكاة‎; [zaˈkaːt], "that which purifies",[1] also Zakat al-mal [zaˈkaːt alˈmaːl] زكاة المال, "zakat on wealth",[2] or Zakah)[3] is a form of almsgiving to the Muslim Ummah[1] treated in Islam as a religious obligation,[4][5] which, by Quranic ranking, is next after prayer (salat) in importance.[6]
